sc.labs.matrices

Class Matrix

  • java.lang.Object
    • sc.labs.matrices.Matrix

  • public class Matrix
extends java.lang.Object
    Matrix class provides an interface for creating matrices of any order which can then be manipulated using other classes such as implementations of the MatrixMultiplier for multiplying matrices.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    saifkhichi96

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int cols
      Number of columns in the matrix.
      private int[][] data
      Actual data of the matrix, stored as a 2D array.
      private int rows
      Number of rows in the matrix.

    • Method Detail

      • setRow

        public void setRow(int index,
                   int[] columns)
            throws java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
        Populates a row of the matrix.
        Parameters:
        index - row number which has to be populated (starting from 0)
        columns - 1D array representing columns of this row
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - exception if either the row number is invalid or columns array has more elements than those specified in the constructor

      • getOrder

        public int[] getOrder()
        Returns order of the matrix.
        Returns:
        array containing number of rows and columns of the matrix

      • getData

        public int[][] getData()
        Returns data of the matrix.
        Returns:
        2D array used to internally store matrix data

      • isMultiplicableWith

        public boolean isMultiplicableWith(Matrix b)
        Checks if the two matrices have compatible orders which can be multiplied. Matrix A of order m x n and matrix B of order p x q can only be multiplied if n == q.
        Parameters:
        b - matrix whose compatibility with this matrix is to be tested
        Returns:
        true if this can be multiplied with given matrix, or false

      • getRows

        public int getRows()
        Returns number of rows in the matrix.
        Returns:
        number of rows

      • getColumns

        public int getColumns()
        Returns number of columns in the matrix.
        Returns:
        number of columns
